*Component items*:
  * *Neck* (*TARGET.TEA.NECK*)
   * *Neck sensory data* (*neck-sensory-data*): skin of medial infraclavicular region
  * *Neck* (*TARGET.TEA.NECK*)
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): elevates first rib, rotate the neck to the opposite side
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): elevate 1st rib, laterally flex (bend) the neck to the same side
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): elevate 2nd rib, tilt the neck to the same side
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): flexes the neck and head
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): sidebend at atlanto-occipital joint, takes care of flexing the neck
   * *Neck flexors* (*neck-flexors*): acting alone, tilts head to its own side and rotates it so the face is turned towards the opposite side; acting together, flexes the neck, raises the sternum and assists in forced inspiration
  * *Neck* (*TARGET.TEA.NECK*)
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): rotation of head and neck
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): extends head and flex head to the ipsilateral side
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): ipsilateral rotation of head and extension
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): extends the head at the neck, but is considered to be more of a sensory organ than a muscle
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): extend the head
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): prime mover for head extension; can also allow lateral flexion and rotation of the cervical spine
   * *Neck extensors* (*neck-extensors*): bilaterally: extend the head and neck, unilaterally: lateral flexion to the same side, rotation to the same side
